Abba Seraphim (born William Henry Hugo Newman-Norton, 27 February 1948) is a British independent Oriental Orthodox bishop. He is the Patriarch of Glastonbury and head of the British Orthodox Church with the title of "His Beatitude Patriarch Seraphim, the British Patriarch of Glastonbury".
In 1975, abba Seraphim also succeeded William Bernard Crow as head of the Order of the Holy Wisdom.: 294

response: In February 1994 a delegation headed by Metropolitan Seraphim of Glastonbury, representing the Orthodox Church of the British Isles, was invited to Egypt by Pope Shenouda III, of the Coptic Orthodox Church. The Coptic Orthodox Pope and Patriarch of Alexandria, Pope Shenouda III, met the delegation and discussed their dogma (they being of Orthodox origin), and the matter of their uniting with the Coptic Church.

Metropolitan Seraphim of Glastonbury is the metropolitan of the Metropolis of Glastonbury and primate of the British Orthodox Church. In January 2019 it was announced that he would be known as His Beatitude Patriarch Seraphim.
